page.title: 12Environmental Issues
page.content: Mrs. Arnold became a Parish Councillor because she wished to become involved in decisions that were being made about Fen Ditton. In 1977 there was a plan to develop the village and build lots of factories and houses there. By becoming a Parish Councillor Mrs. Arnold helped to frustrate those plans. Her main concern now is with preserving the green belt around the village to prevent it from becoming a suburb of Cambridge. She is also active in trying to minimise the damage caused and dangers posed to the residents by large numbers of vehicles passing through the village due to its main road being used as a slip road connecting the new A45 by-pass and the Newmarket Road. Mrs. Arnold also monitors carefully the use of pesticides and insectisides by farmers, especially near the school.
